question:
In light of J&K losing its special status, consider the following statements:
  1. J&K will not have its own flag after passing of the Reorganisation bill.
  2. The civil service cadre specific to J&K will be scrapped.
  3. The resultant UTs will be governed by Lieutenant Governors.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The J&K state has its own flag and constitution apart from the Indian counterpart. The J&K flag has 3 stripes representing the regions of Jammu, Kashmir and Ladakh. It dependence on farming is indicated by a plough. With the passage of the bill, the flag will be removed. Only the Indian tricolor will be hoisted in the UTs. Statement 2 is correct: The J&K cadre of civil servants will be scrapped. The system used for other 7 UTs will now apply to the new UTs. The cadre will now be absorbed into the AGMUT cadre. The AGMUT cadre (Arunachal Pradesh, Goa, Mizoram and other UTs) caters to postings for the 3 states and the 9 UTs.Â  Statement 3 is correct: The UTs will be governed by the Lieutenant Governors. They are the representatives of the President in the UTs. In J&K UT, the legislative assembly with the CM will inform the LG abut its legislations. The UTs are to be governed like the other UTs of the country.
